intro: Sphaeralcea martii, commonly known as the Miller's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its globular, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually gray-green and hairy, helping to reduce water loss. Sphaeralcea martii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, contributing to the ecological diversity of these regions.
